Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
website:
- seller post data.
- without knowing any info of the buyers.
- buyer pays, and gets the data.

In case of website:
- the buyer doesn't has to always be present.
- don't have to re-post the data again. But I guess this point is not true exactly, in case the inventory is all sold, and then seller has to update it. But if it's just some digital data bytes, it is a one time task for seller.

The same model does not apply to Blockchain as I understood.
- Seller has to know the buyer's info. prior to posting the data to sell. Like `pubkey`
- Seller posts the encrypted data. Only the buyers who's pubkey was known to buyer can decrypt the data.
- Another set of buyers wait for the seller to post the data again to get the same data posted by the seller so they can decrypt it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you are encrypting each copy, then you cant publish until somebody pays and you can get their pubkey from the payment

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: buyer pays oracle, publisher encrypts data to the buyer and collects the datafee

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you are making it a LOT more complex

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it can be literally transactional and noninteractive

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: buyer pays

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: by paying buyer spends funds and reveals his pubkey

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: seller sees the payment and to collect the funds must publish, so extracts the buyers pubkey and encrypts, publishes and collects datafee

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: yes, these steps are clear, thanks for making more clearer üôÇ

Content: @Alright Reproduced this issue with oraclessamples on jl777: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/K7R8rxsXj2/ (wrote some comments between steps)

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Actually its breaking when you register second time. I think it was there for a long time, just additional indicator such as txid and `0` param which allows to check all samples making tracking easier

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Used other txfee: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/q8hwmbghMX/ so I think issue now isolated. Problem is that on each new oraclesregister creating new publisher and batontxid in oraclesinfo changing to this oraclesregister txid and previous samples "losing" because oraclessamples for this baton return nothing

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: CC [@Mihailo]

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @Alright So actually because of such oraclesCC bug in your voting TUI now possible to "change" vote each time when you oraclesregister + oraclesdata again

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @TonyL @Alright I'll get on it right now.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @TonyL @Alright The thing is that when you register it is creating new baton and not connecting to existing one so there is no way to find previous samples. But I'm not sure if it is supposed to work like that... And the bug can be that when you do oraclesinfo it shows you two registers with same baton, there it should show baton for each register and then you can get samples for one or the other... As there could be data that publisher wants to publish at different cost so he could do both. @jl777c ???

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
According to "Mastering cryptoconditions" there was such idea initially:
```A data publisher needs to register a datafee and their pubkey for a specific oracletxid. datafee needs to be at least as big as a txfee. Using oraclesregister the current datafee can be updated so a publisher can adapt to market conditions.```

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: It is just a question if there should be both datafees or only one at the time.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: So register just should overwrite datafee, not sure if path to previous data should be lost - I wonder only datafee need to adjust on next registers after first one

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: If only one is current, then when doing second register previous baton should be connected. If both are active than each needs to have its own baton.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
And in oraclesinfo should be overwriting of publisher entry rather than appending.
Because actually `oraclesdata` not allows you to choose between different datafee publishers or something like that - it have only oracletxid and datahex as params. So from it follows that by design each pubkey should have only single publisher in oracle - not multiple

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yes, lets see what @jl777c had in mind.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Another thing is that oraclessamples is made in that way that it is looking just for oraclesdata txs. So when it reaches register it will stop there....

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I do think this was introduced after the inception of oracles CC

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I think this was made like this initially

Author: Alright#0419
Content: never had the problem while we were testing trollbox, maybe the underlying bug was always there, but the behavior to trigger it changed?
